description.narrative: Det övergripande målet för KtKs program för 2016-2019 är ökad respekt för kvinnors rättigheter. Projektet är en förtsättning på tidligare stöd men har ett smalare tematiskt fokus, vilket bedöms relevant och lämpligt i en avslutande fas. Projektet är mycket relevant för Serbiens EU integrationsagenda.

Kvinna till Kvinna (KtK) ansöker om 23 583 500 SEK över perioden 2016-2019 för programmet "Strengthening Women’s Rights and Women’s Participation in Serbia". Det övergripande syftet är att bidra till ökad jämställdhet och använda EU-integrationsprocessen (EUI) som hävstång för detta. KtK ska stödja kvinnoorganisationer som arbetar för kvinnors rättigheter och motverkar våld mot kvinnor, bidra till att stärka redan aktiva nätverk för kvinnoorganisationer som arbetar för jämställdhet samt öka kvinnors deltagande och synlighet i politiken och samhället. KtK ska stödja Reconstruction Woment Fund (RWF) som är en lokal insamlingsstiftelse i Serbien. RWFs roll är att ge ekonomiskt stöd och att förmedla kontakt mellan lokala kvinnoorganisationer.
Insatsen ska ses som en avslutande fas i KtKs arbete i Serbien. Denna insats bygger på tidligare erfarenheter, men har ett smalare tematiskt fokus och är mindre omfattande än tidligare samarbeten.

The Kvinna till kvinna (KtK) program aims to strengthen women's rights and women's equal participation in decision-making in Serbia. Intended programme outcome is increased prioritisation of women’s human rights by the Government of Serbia, with special regards to gender based violence (GBV).

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

title.narrative: Beslut on insats Kvinna till kvinna Serbien 2016-2019

description.narrative: This Conclusion on Performance is based on information provided through continuous follow-up of the contribution mainly through meetings and dialogue in 2020, as well as reports that Kvinna till kvnna provided in line with the Agreement. The Embassy considers that interaction with our cooperation partners is the most important part of the follow-up of the intervention. In response to corona crisis in 2020, the Embassy engaged to intensify dialogue with our partners on changed conditions for their activities to assess whether there are risks of not being able to implement parts of planned and agreed activities, and what adjustments to budgets and plans may be justified. The Embassy's starting point is to take a flexible approach to making justified adjustments to plans and budgets and -as always - the starting point is that aid should have as high effectiveness as possible. Kvinna till kvinna provided the agreed semi annual report for period 1 January – 31 May 2020, and it outlines no major deviations in the reporting period and implementations according to approved plans and the Agreement, however it includes timelines adjusted to COVID19 situation as well as Kvinna till kvinna efforts to switch to online activities whenever assessed as feasible and efficient. Kvinna till kvinna reported that the first half of the 2020, especially March, April and May were committed to a great extent to adjusting and exercising monitoring to the changing circumstances, capacity development for online work and establishing new procedures. Kvinna till kvinna reports no significant deviations in relation to partners’ projects, however the assessment is that the implementing partners experienced challenges in their advocacy work since the state institutions under corona circumstances operated at reduced capacity, and many processes related to women's human rights and gender equality were delayed. Gender based violence (GBV) challenges increased in 2020 especially bearing in mind the period of lockdown when the state introduced temporary measures of limited movements for citizens. Stress, loss of income and isolation all can exacerbate the risk of violence and domestic abuse for women. Victims were facing locked doors at state institutions, lack of clarity about availability of services and protection during the curfew, as well as difficulty in accessing safehouses. Especially during April-July 2020, the SOS helpline saw increases in the number of first-time callers, in requests for assistance, and in the number of calls. Good contact was established with the Ministry of Justice, which is one example of good praxis, as Kvinna till kvinna reported at the ARM in June 2020. Autonomous Women Center (AWC) SOS Help line received in the first half of 2020 a total of 238 women calls, out of which 190 women contacted AWC for the first time. Individual psychosocial consultations were held 239 times for different beneficiaries. ? total of 1159 services were provided through the SOS helpline and “face to face” counselling in order to support and empower women survivors of violence. Women contacted AWC via e-mail 20 times. Reconstruction Women Fund (RWF) in the first half of 2020 supported nine organisations and groups with diverse geographical coverage (from Vojvodina to southern Serbia) and with high inclusion of different vulnerable social groups (women with disabilities; Roma women; young women; women from rural areas), in their work towards changing attitudes regarding GBV and domestic violence. Autonomous Girls Center (AGC) and Katalysta designed an online survey in order to identify the needs of girls in Serbia in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic. The survey provided an overview of the impact of multiple aspects of the pandemic on the wellbeing of girls with the focus on areas such as safety (from domestic, partner and online violence) and health. It also gave an insight into the various experiences, feelings and needs of the girls in Serbia in the relation to the situation of the pandemic. Overall, the programme maintains potential to deliver results.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
